result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. in court for Adarrius A Findley.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Agent Wagner appeared via phone. Atty Gleason filed a bond motion and requesting a signature bond in both cases for Defn to be transferred to Lincoln Hills School. State has no obj as long as defn remains in custody until transported to Lincoln Hills.  Colloquy with Agent regarding custody status until transport to Lincoln Hills. CT orders signature bond for purposes of transport to Lincoln Hills only in both cases. All previously ordered conditions remain the same.
Filed by Atty Gleason
Bail/bond hearing on August 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 2

*IN CUSTODY* 
Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court, in custody. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. in court for Adarrius A Findley.  Attorney Frank Remington for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Co-Defendant Everette Olle in court with Attorney Tracey Lencioni. State moves court to find counts transactionally related in both cases. No objection by Attorney Gleason. Objection by Attorney Lencioni on behalf of Mr. Olle. Argument. Court finds counts within both cases transactionally related. Officer NC duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Remington. Venue established. DEs identified. Cross by Attorney Lencioni. Cross by Attorney Gleason. Officer LH duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Remington. No cross. State moves for b/o in both cases, waives argument for rebuttal. Attorney Lencioni objects to b/o, waives argument. Attorney Gleason objects to b/o, argument. Court finds PC a felony was committed in both cases and binds case over.

*IN CUSTODY* 
Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court, in custody. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. in court for Adarrius A Findley.  Attorney Frank Remington for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. DE's motion to dismiss. Argument. Court denies motion to dismiss.
filed by Atty Gleason
Atty Brian Gleason

Trial Judge - Br 2

01:39 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
